property.name: hive.cube.disable.auto.join
property.description: Tells whether to disable automatic resolution of join conditions between tables involved. To enable automatic resolution, this value should be false.

property.name: hive.cube.join.type
property.description: Tells what the join type is, in-case of automatic resolution of joins is enabled

property.name: hive.cube.disable.aggregate.resolver
property.description: Tells whether to disable automatic resolution of aggregations for measures in a cube. To enable automatic resolution, this value should be false.

property.name: cube.query.promote.groupby.toselect
property.description: Tells whether to promote group by clauses to be promoted to select expressions if they are already not projected. To enable automatic promotion, this value should be true.

property.name: cube.query.promote.select.togroupby
property.description: Tells whether to promote select expressions which is not inside any aggregate, to be promoted to groupby clauses, if they are already not part of groupby clauses. To enable automatic promotion, this value should be true.

property.name: cube.query.valid.dim.storgaetables
property.description: List of comma separated dimension storage tables that are valid. If no value is specified, all tables are valid

property.name: cube.query.driver.supported.storages
property.description: List of comma separated storage names that supported by a driver. If no value is specified, all storages are valid

property.name: cube.query.valid.${cubename}.facttables
property.description: List of comma separated fact tables that are valid for cube. If no value is specified, all fact tables are valid

property.name: cube.query.valid.fact.${facttable}.storagetables
property.description: List of comma separated storage tables that are valid for a fact. If no value is specified, all storage tables are valid

property.name: cube.query.valid.fact.${facttable}.storage.${storagename}.updateperiods
property.description: List of comma separated update periods that are valid for a fact on a storage. If no value is specified, all update periods are valid

property.name: cube.query.fail.if.data.partial
property.description: Whether to fail the query of data is partial

property.name: cube.query.nonexisting.partitions
property.description: The list of comma separated non existing partitions, if query can run with partial data. The value will be set by the cube query rewriter

property.name: cube.query.enable.multi.table.select
property.description: Tells whether multiple tables are allowed in from clause of final HQL query

property.name: cube.query.max.interval
property.description: Maximum value of the update period that the query timed dimensions can take values of. For example, if query involves month ranges, user can say query maximum interval is daily, then no monthly partitions will be picked.

property.name: cube.query.process.time.partition.column
property.description: The column name which is a process time column. If process time column is specified, query rewriter will look ahead the partitions of other timed dimensions inside this column.

property.name: cube.query.lookahead.ptparts.forinterval.${interval}
property.description: The value of number of lookahead process time partitions for interval specified. Interval can be any Update period.

property.name: cube.query.replace.timedim
property.description: Tells whether timedim attribute queried in the time range should be replaced with its corresponding partition column name.

property.name: cube.query.pick.lightest.fact.first
property.description: If set to true, lightest fact will be resolved first than resolving storages. Otherwise, storages will be resolved to check all partitions exist and then pick lightest fact among candidates

property.name: cube.query.time.range.writer.class
property.description: The timerange writer class which specifies how the resolved partitions in timeranges should be written in final query. Available writers are org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.cube.parse.ORTimeRangeWriter and org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.cube.parse.BetweenTimeRangeWriter

property.name: cube.query.partition.where.clause.format
property.description: The simple date format of how the queried partition should be put in where clause. If nothing is specified, it will use the format from org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.cube.metadata.UpdatePeriod for each type of partition
